# 12 Best Business Coaches to Follow in 2023

Reading Time: 4 Minutes

### Table of Contents

  1. Marshall Goldsmith
  2. Allison Dunn (Deliberate Directions)
  3. Tony Robbins
  4. Jay Abraham
  5. Nick Loper (Side Hustle Nation)
  6. John Maxwell
  7. Barry Moltz (The Unstuck Guy)
  8. Tammy Adams (Local Small Business Coach)
  9. John Mattone
  10. Alan Melton (Small Business Coach Associates)
  11. Melinda Emerson (The Small Biz Lady)
  12. Tristan Wright (Evolve to Grow)

## 1\. Marshall Goldsmith

Learn how to be a more effective leader and business owner with Marshall’s
articles and videos. Get updates on new material through his Facebook.

#### Website: marshallgoldsmith.com

## 2\. Allison Dunn (Deliberate Directions)

Allison Dunn teaches you how to scale your business and advance your
leadership skills on her blog and YouTube. Listen to Allison’s Deliberate
Leaders Podcast on iTunes or Spotify. Get updates on new content from the
Deliberate Directions LinkedIn page.

#### Website: deliberatedirections.com

## 3\. Tony Robbins

Take assessments on Tony’s website to learn more about yourself and where you
want to go. Listen to Tony’s podcast episodes with celebrities and leading
thinkers. Read Tony’s business articles, watch his videos, and follow him on
Facebook for more updates.

#### Website: tonyrobbins.com

## 4\. Jay Abraham

Learn how to solve problems in your business with Jay’s YouTube channel,
podcast, and blog. Follow him on Facebook for updates. Jay posts entire
keynotes and book study notes so you can take in a great deal of information
for free.

#### Website: abraham.com

## 5\. Nick Loper (Side Hustle Nation)

Nick Loper teaches you how to earn money outside of traditional jobs and grow
your side hustle into a fulfilling business. Listen to his popular podcast on
iTunes or Android. For more updates, follow his blog and Facebook.

#### Website: sidehustlenation.com

## 6\. John Maxwell

After you read John’s bestseller, 21 Irrefutable Laws of Leadership, follow
his blog and Facebook for ongoing bite-sized leadership advice.

#### Website: johnmaxwell.com

## 7\. Barry Moltz (The Unstuck Guy)

Do you feel your business is stuck? Listen to Barry’s small business podcast
on iTunes or Spotify, then check out his popular books “How to Get Unstuck”
and “Small Business Hacks.” Follow Barry on Facebook to stay up to date on his
latest podcast episodes.

#### Website: barrymoltz.com

## 8\. Tammy Adams (Local Small Business Coach)

Get Tammy’s “8 Steps to Profit” ebook, follow Tammy on YouTube, and listen to
Tammy’s podcast on iTunes or Stitcher. If you’d like more, check out Tammy’s
courses on starting a local business.

#### Website: localsmallbusinesscoach.com

## 9\. John Mattone

Develop yourself as a leader with John’s blog. Get updates when new articles
are released from his Facebook.

#### Website: johnmattone.com

## 11\. Alan Melton (Small Business Coach Associates)

Get tips on planning, team building, sales, developing yourself, and more on
Alan’s Facebook and blog. You can also learn more by purchasing Alan’s
webinars.

#### Website: smallbusinesscoach.org

## 12\. Melinda Emerson (The Small Biz Lady)

Get tips on starting and running a small business from Melinda’s blog and
ebooks. Follow Melinda on Facebook for videos, articles, and updates. Melinda
covers the basics of marketing, social media, accounting, and finance in a way
that any beginner can follow along.

#### Website: succeedasyourownboss.com

## 13\. Tristan Wright (Evolve to Grow)

Want to know how you can begin with the end in mind? Check out Tristan’s ebook
10 Simple Principles to Grow the Perfect Business. Get business insights on
his Facebook or LinkedIn. You can also join his Facebook Group, The Business
Evolution.

#### Website: evolvetogrow.com.au

# Everything You Need to Know About Business Coaching

Reading Time: 5 Minutes

Whether you’re a startup entrepreneur or a seasoned business owner, business
coaching can provide you with the guidance, support, and strategies necessary
to thrive in today’s competitive market.

Join us as we embark on this comprehensive exploration of business coaching,
equipping you with the knowledge and understanding necessary to harness its
power and drive your personal and professional success.

### Table of Contents

  1. What Is Business Coaching?
  2. What Does a Business Coach Do?
  3. The Benefits of Business Coaching
  4. How to Find the Right Business Coach for You
  5. Different Types of Business Coaching
  6. Common Challenges in Business Coaching
  7. Measuring the Success of Business Coaching

## What Is Business Coaching?

Business coaching is a professional relationship between a coach and a
business owner, executive, or team, aimed at enhancing the individual or
group’s business performance, effectiveness, and overall success. It is a
collaborative partnership between a trained coach and a client (coachee),
where the coach provides guidance, support, and expertise.

## What Does a Business Coach Do?

A business coach is an advisor, mentor, strategist, facilitator, and partner,
who empowers their clients to reach their full potential in their professional
and personal lives. Business coaches work with their clients to identify their
strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement.

### Coaches Provide Guidance and Support

Business coaches offer a fresh perspective. They ask thought-provoking
questions and offer insights that can help clients navigate complex business
challenges. By acting as a sounding board, coaches provide a safe and non-
judgmental space for clients to explore ideas, gain clarity, and make informed
decisions.

### Coaches Share Expertise and Experience

Business coaches bring their expertise and experience to provide insights,
strategies, and tools specific to the client’s industry and challenges. A good
coach will adapt their approach and methodologies to address the individual
circumstances of each client, ensuring that their coaching is relevant and
impactful.

### Coaches Help You Set Goals and Plan Action

Coaches work closely with clients to define clear and achievable goals, align
them with the client’s vision and values, and develop action plans to drive
progress. They provide accountability and support throughout the journey,
ensuring that clients stay focused, motivated, and on track toward their
desired outcomes.

### Coaches Develop Your Skills and Optimize Performance

Coaches assist clients in identifying their strengths and areas for
improvement. Then, they help clients enhance their skills and capabilities.
Coaches provide resources to optimize performance, improve productivity, and
achieve higher levels of efficiency.

### Coaches Unlock Potential and Foster Personal Growth

Coaches help clients uncover their untapped potential by challenging self-
limiting beliefs and developing a growth mindset. Through self-reflection,
goal alignment, and continuous learning, clients are empowered to maximize
their capabilities, build confidence, and achieve personal and professional
growth.

### Coaches Help with Strategic Thinking and Problem-Solving

Coaches guide clients in developing strategic plans, making critical
decisions, and solving complex problems. By encouraging innovative thinking
and offering frameworks for decision-making, coaches enable clients to
navigate challenges and seize opportunities with confidence.

Coaches may use various techniques and approaches tailored to the specific
needs of their clients. These can include asking powerful questions, providing
feedback, challenging limiting beliefs, facilitating brainstorming sessions,
teaching new skills, and offering perspectives and insights from their own
experience and expertise.

## The Benefits of Business Coaching

The benefits of business coaching are numerous and far-reaching, impacting
personal growth, professional development, and organizational success.

### Enhanced Self-Awareness and Personal Growth

Business coaching helps leaders gain a deeper understanding of their
strengths, weaknesses, and potential areas for improvement. It promotes
personal growth by encouraging self-reflection, building confidence, and
developing new skills.

### Goal setting and action planning

A business coach assists in setting clear, achievable goals and developing a
roadmap to reach them. To ensure their clients’ progress, coaches provide
accountability, support, and strategies to stay focused and motivated.

### Improved Decision-Making

Coaches provide a fresh perspective and help business owners and executives
make informed decisions. They challenge assumptions, offer alternative
viewpoints, and facilitate critical thinking to enable better decision-making.

### Enhanced Leadership Skills

Business coaching focuses on developing effective leadership qualities
including communication, delegation, and problem-solving. Coaches also guide
clients to hone a leadership style that works for them and their organization.

### Increased Productivity and Performance

By identifying obstacles and implementing productivity-enhancing techniques,
business coaching improves overall performance and efficiency. Coaches help
their clients optimize their workflow, manage time more effectively, and
prioritize skill acquisition.

## How to Find the Right Business Coach for You

Finding the right business coach can be a transformative step toward achieving
your business goals.

### Determine Your Coaching Needs

Assess your specific needs and goals before seeking a coach. Consider factors
such as industry expertise, coaching style, and the areas where you’d like to
grow.

### Research and Referrals

Seek recommendations from trusted sources, such as colleagues, mentors, or
industry associations. Research potential coaches online and review their
credentials, testimonials, and areas of specialization.

### Consultation and Chemistry

Schedule consultations with potential coaches to discuss your goals and gauge
compatibility. Chemistry and rapport are crucial for a successful coaching
relationship, so choose a coach with whom you feel comfortable and understood.

### Evaluate Experience and Qualifications

Verify the coach’s experience, qualifications, and credentials. Look for
certifications from reputable coaching organizations and inquire about their
previous clients and success stories.

### Clear Expectations and Agreements

Establish clear expectations regarding coaching frequency, duration, fees, and
confidentiality. Ensure you and the coach are aligned on the coaching process,
goals, and desired outcomes.

## Different Types of Business Coaching

Business coaching comes in various forms, tailored to address specific needs.
Understanding the different types of business coaching available can help you
identify the most relevant approach for your goals.

### Executive Coaching

Executive coaching develops the leadership skills and performance of top-level
executives and business owners. It addresses challenges specific to high-level
decision-making, strategic planning, and organizational management.

### Leadership Coaching

Leadership coaching is designed to enhance leadership capabilities at all
levels of an organization. It helps clients develop essential leadership
skills, such as effective communication, team management, and decision-making.

### Sales Coaching

Sales coaching aims to improve sales skills, techniques, and strategies. This
focuses on areas such as prospecting, negotiation, closing deals, building
long-term customer relationships, and closing deals effectively.

### Marketing Coaching

Marketing coaching assists businesses in developing marketing strategies,
identifying target markets, refining brand messaging, and maximizing the
impact of their marketing efforts.

### Startup Coaching

Startup coaching provides guidance and support to entrepreneurs starting their
own businesses. Startup coaching addresses challenges such as business
planning, funding, market entry, and scaling.

### Career Coaching

Career coaching supports individuals in navigating their professional paths,
making career transitions, and achieving their career goals. It involves
assessing skills, exploring career options, and developing strategies for
growth and advancement.

## Common Challenges in Business Coaching

While business coaching can be immensely beneficial, it is not without its
challenges. Understanding and addressing these challenges is essential for a
successful coaching experience.

### Resistance to Change

Some clients resist implementing new strategies or making necessary changes
due to fear, comfort zones, or limiting beliefs. Coaches help clients navigate
through resistance.

### Lack of Commitment or Follow-Through

Sustained effort and accountability are crucial for achieving coaching goals.
Coaches motivate and hold clients accountable to ensure consistent progress.

### Misalignment of Expectations

Clear communication and setting realistic expectations are vital to avoid
misunderstandings. Coaches and clients must be aligned on the coaching
process, goals, and outcomes.

### Limited Resources

In certain cases, budget constraints or limited resources can pose challenges.
Coaches work with clients to identify creative solutions and prioritize
actions that yield the greatest impact.

## Measuring the Success of Business Coaching

Measuring success is crucial to understand the impact and ensure a return on
investment. While coaching outcomes can be subjective, there are tangible ways
to assess effectiveness.

### Goal Attainment

A coach should have measurable ways to assess a client’s progress throughout
the coaching process and to determine when a goal has been achieved.

### Feedback and Testimonials

Good coaches solicit feedback from clients to gauge their impact on clients’
growth and to check how satisfied clients are with their results.

### Behavioral Changes

Coaches should evaluate if there have been noticeable positive changes in the
client’s behavior, decision-making, and leadership skills.

### Business Outcomes

Many coaches measure the impact of coaching on key business metrics, such as
revenue growth, customer satisfaction, employee engagement, or productivity.

## Conclusion

Business coaching offers numerous benefits for leaders and organizations. It
provides invaluable support, guidance, and strategies to help with goal
attainment. Whether you’re a startup entrepreneur or an established business
owner, finding the right business coach can make a significant difference in
the success of your business.
